resources.string: DallasTourGuideApp
Little Forest Hills
A place it\'s great I promise
Truckyard
Truckyard is an eclectic gathering of food trucks and vintage chairs and tables
Image of 3 people at the Truckyard
Flying Saucer
The walls and ceiling of this place are covered with personalized plates of those who have tried a minimum of 300 different beers at Flying Saucer
Image of 3 people at Flying Saucer
Keller\'s Drive-In
Keller\'s is a classic Texas experience. Beers, burgers, and shakes delivered to your vehicle as you admire the culture of cars, trucks, and motorcycles.
Image of Texans with motorcycles in a parking lot
Music

Music is an integral part of Dallas culture. Dallas is famous for being a stop for bands and musicians travelling across the States. This has lead to a great turn out in Dallas for just about any band hoping to make a tour through America. Bands always seem to have a good time with Dallas crowds as they are often full and lively.
Image of the band Beach House performing
Museums
Dallas has it\'s fair share of museums to offer
Image of TTTTTTTTTTTTT
Architecture
Architecture of downtown Dallas is famous for
an image of
Deep Ellum
To truly experience the Art world of Dallas, and a great piece of what Texas has to offer, Deep Ellum is a must visit.
Backyard Culture
Backyard BBQ\'s, firepits, parties, and hangouts are such a common part of Dallas culture it would be surprising to live in Dallas for one year and not be invited to one.
Image of Matt in a backyard
Company Celebrations
It is common in Dallas for companies to celebrate milestones by throwing parties for employees. Often the parties are family friendly and include musical guests, face painting, and balloon makers.
Katie kissing her mother, both with face make up
Rock Climbing

Rock climbing is a very popular aspect of Dallas culture. Members of Team Texas travel great distances to practice and compete together. It is also commonly used for team building and for couples going on dates.
Dallas Arboretum
Nested between Little Forest Hills and White Rock Lake, the Dallas Arboretum is always blooming with flowers, culture, and events.
Image of 3 people at the Dallas Arboretum
White Rock Lake
White Rock Lake has a two way paved trail open to pedestrians, longboarders, roller skaters, and bicyclists.
Image of a bicycle by a tree at White Rock Lake
Lake Texoma
Between the states of Oklahoma and Texas, Lake Texoma is a destination trip from Dallas, but provides some of the closest locations for those looking for a beautiful backpacking trip.
Cedar Ridge Preserve
A popular destination for weekend hikers or even those training for events, Cedar Ridge Preserve is the best and closest set of nature trails to Dallas.
